instruction: Analyze the following veterinary clinical note and predict the SNOMED-CT diagnosis codes.
input: Clinical Note: Dog, 9 years old, Beagle. Skin lesions with hair loss, intense itching, secondary bacterial infection. Worse in summer months.

instruction: Based on the clinical findings, identify the most likely SNOMED-CT diagnosis codes.
input: Clinical Note: Cat, 6 years old, Ragdoll. Difficulty defecating, hard dry stool, straining. Appetite normal, otherwise healthy.

instruction: What are the appropriate SNOMED-CT codes for this veterinary case?
input: Clinical Note: Bird, 5 years old, African Grey. Plucking feathers, self-mutilation behavior, loud vocalizations. Recent change in environment.

instruction: Predict the SNOMED-CT classifications for this veterinary patient.
input: Clinical Note: Horse, 8 years old, Thoroughbred. Lameness in left hind limb, heat and swelling in fetlock joint. Reluctant to bear weight.
